definition: muddled and completely collapsing (idiom); in an awful condition/complete shambles/a total mess
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to collapse/to droop/to settle down
muddled/paste/scorched
paste/cream
to apply (paint etc)/to smear/to daub/to blot out/to scribble/to scrawl/(literary) mud/street

sentences.english: Hungarian-language schools teach Slovak remarkably badly.
sentences.chinese: 匈牙利語學校教的斯洛伐克語一塌糊塗。

sentences.english: Better still, the pigs' immune systems are in free-fall.
sentences.chinese: 更讓病毒暢行無阻的是，豬的免疫系統一塌糊塗。

sentences.english: Stop obfuscating the information and embellishing it.
sentences.chinese: 不要再刻意潤飾各種一塌糊塗的信息了。
地產市場還是一塌糊塗。

sentences.english: The student"s bedroom looked like something the cat dragged in."
sentences.chinese: 這位學生的臥室，髒得一塌糊塗。

sentences.english: I made a proper balls - up of that exam.
sentences.chinese: 那次考試我考得一塌糊塗。

sentences.english: She make a shambles of things.
sentences.chinese: 她把事情搞嘚一塌糊塗。

sentences.english: The margins of his notebook were festooned with doodles.
sentences.chinese: 他的筆記本的空白邊被塗得一塌糊塗。

sentences.english: It's a hot day. It's been too tired to many hikers just passing Chi Gu Ping village.
sentences.chinese: 天氣熱之過，剛過赤菇坪村就把人累得一塌糊塗了。

sentences.english: She make a mess of entities.
sentences.chinese: 她把事情搞嘚一塌糊塗。

sentences.english: The spilt milk made a terrible mess on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 牛奶灑在地板上弄得一塌糊塗。

sentences.english: This year, the shattered economy has canceled Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 今年，一塌糊塗的經濟勾消了聖誕節的狂歡。

sentences.english: You are such a person is to take the time to gamble and lose in a complete mess.
sentences.chinese: 你等一個人就是拿時間去賭然後輸得一塌糊塗。

sentences.english: Much depends on whether organised protest turns into disorganised chaos.
sentences.chinese: 關鍵在於有組織的抗議是否會變爲一塌糊塗的混亂。

sentences.english: Atty so drunk that trial suspended.
sentences.chinese: 律師醉得一塌糊塗，因此審判被暫停。

sentences.english: The spilt milk made a terrible mess on the carpet.
sentences.chinese: 牛奶灑在地毯上弄得一塌糊塗。

definition: sometimes good, sometimes bad
bad/no good/below average/disappointing
to be unable to withstand a single blow/to collapse at the first blow
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
any Tom, Dick or Harry/anyone (contemptuous)
hard to understand/incomprehensible
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
original identity fully revealed (idiom); fig. to unmask and expose the whole truth
to be unable to breathe
to have good luck/lucky/in luck
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
both sides suffer (idiom)/neither side wins
to mend one's ways (idiom)/to turn over a new leaf
bustling/energetic
